IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: WORK TOGETHER TO PROMOTE FAIRNESS, JUSTICE & EQUALITY IN THE WORKPLACE & IN SOCIETY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: WORK TOGETHER TO IMPROVE JOBS, BUILD A BETTER FUTURE, PROMOTE FAIRNESS, JUSTICE AND EQUALITY IN THE WORKPLACE AND SOCIETY.
IRS990.Desc: NEGOTIATION OF COLLECTIVE BARGAINING AGREEMENTS AND THE ADMINISTRATION AND ENFORCEMENT OF THE AGREEMENTS MADE BY THE LABOR ORGANIZATION

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: ORGANIZING EFFORTS TO BECOME THE EXCLUSIVE BARGAINING REPRESENTATIVE FOR ANY UNIT OF EMPLOYEES AND TO RECRUIT NEW MEMBERS

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: ASSISTING WITH LOCAL UNION ADMINISTRATION INCLUDING MEMBERSHIP EDUCATION PROGRAMS, MEMBERSHIP MEETINGS AND ELECTIONS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES INFORMATION TO ITS MEMBERS ABOUT ELECTORAL CAMPAIGNS & ISSUES, ENCOURAGES ITS MEMBERS TO PARTICIPATE IN THE ELECTORAL PROCESS, AND COLLABORATES WITH OTHER LABOR ORGANIZATIONS AND ALLIED GROUPS ON ELECTORAL MATTERS, ALL IN ORDER TO SERVE THE BEST INTERESTS OF THE ORGANIZATION'S MEMBERS, THEIR FAMILIES AND ALL WORKING PEOPLE.
GRANTS ARE APPROVED BY APPROPRIATE SUPERVISING PERSONNEL PRIOR TO PAYMENT AND REVIEWED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH INTERNALLY IMPOSED GUIDELINES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP: ALL INDIVIDUALS LISTED IN PART VII, SECTION A. EACH INDIVIDUAL LISTED ABOVE AS HAVING A BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP IS EMPLOYED BY UNITED STEEL, PAPER AND FORESTRY, RUBBER, MANUFACTURING, ENERGY, ALLIED INDUSTRIAL AND SERVICE WORKERS INTERNATIONAL UNION (USW) FOR WHICH THEY ALSO SERVE AS EITHER AN OFFICER OR DIRECTOR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: USW ACTIVE MEMBERS PAY FULL DUES. THEY HAVE THE RIGHT TO VOTE. ASSOCIATE MEMBERS DO NOT MEET THE REQUIREMENT FOR FULL MEMBERSHIP. THEY ARE NOT EMPLOYED IN A BARGAINING UNIT REPRESENTED BY THE UNION. ASSOCIATE MEMBERS ARE ENTITLED TO VOTE WITHIN THE ASSOCIATE MEMBER ORGANIZATION. ASSOCIATE MEMBERS DO NOT PAY FULL REGULAR DUES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: USW ACTIVE MEMBERS IN GOOD STANDING MAY VOTE IN LOCAL AND INTERNATIONAL ELECTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: USW CONSTITUTIONAL AMENDMENTS MAY BE MADE BY A MAJORITY VOTE OF THE DELEGATES AT THE INTERNATIONAL CONVENTION AND DISTRICT CHANGES MAY BE MADE BY A MAJORITY VOTE OF THE DELEGATES AT DISTRICT CONFERENCES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 8B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE INTERNATIONAL EXECUTIVE BOARD DOES NOT AUTHORIZE COMMITTEES TO ACT ON ITS BEHALF, THEREFORE, NO MINUTES ARE NECESSARY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPLETED FORM 990 WAS REVIEWED BY THE USW'S SECRETARY/TREASURER'S OFFICE BEFORE FILING WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE UNION DOES NOT ROUTINELY MAKE SUCH DOCUMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, QUESTIONS 15A AND 15B:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL BASE SALARIES OF THE USW INTERNATIONAL OFFICERS AND DISTRICT DIRECTORS WERE APPROVED BY MAJORITY VOTE OF USW MEMBERS, ALL OF WHOM ARE INDEPENDENT WITH RESPECT TO COMPENSATION MATTERS, IN AUGUST 2014. ANNUAL SALARY CHANGES ARE BENCHMARKED AGAINST CHANGES IN USW MEMBERS EARNINGS. THEREFORE, THE PROCESS INCORPORATES COMPARABILITY DATA AND IS INTENDED TO SATISFY THE REASONABLE COMPENSATION SAFE HARBOR SET FORTH IN THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND THE REGULATIONS ENACTED THEREUNDER. ALL AMENDMENTS TO THE CONSTITUTION ARE APPROVED BY A MAJORITY OF USW MEMBERS ALL OF WHOM ARE INDEPENDENT WITH RESPECT TO COMPENSATION MATTERS.
